item.title: Our Environment
item.description: 1. Ecosystems An ecosystem is a complex system which consists of all the living organisms and the non-living constituents of an area. These may include: Biotic components, comprising living organisms Abiotic components, including physical factors like temperature rainfall wind soil 1.1 Examples of Ecosystems Take a pond for example. A variety of animals and plants (biotic components) can be found in and around a pond. These living beings are dependent on each other as well as the surrounding water, air and soil (abiotic components).
